title: LibDem's Jo Swinson 'relishes' December election as way to force Brexit extension
text:
Jo Swinson declared yesterday that she relished the prospect of a December general election as she insisted it was the best way of forcing an EU extension to Brexit until at least January 31.

The LibDem leader also challenged Labour to back her proposed Bill for an election on December 9 as it would remove the threat of a no deal Brexit, as Jeremy Corbyn had demanded.

With the Number 10 sources indicating they would consider such a Bill as an option, Ms Swinson said: “They [Labour] should be able to support this proposal.

“It would set the date for the next election on December 9, but crucially it would be conditional on there being an extension to Article 50 which would mean ‘No Deal’ was taken...
description: Jo Swinson declared yesterday that she relished the prospect of a December general election as she insisted it was the best way of forcing an EU extension to Brexit until at least January 31.
